summary.para: The Remotion.Data.DomainObjects.Infrastructure namespace contains classes implementing the DomainObjects framework.
Types or interfaces in this namespace are not intended to be used directly from an application.
The Remotion.Data.DomainObjects.ObjectBinding namespace contains classes and interfaces for 2-way data binding of user controls to domain objects.
The Remotion.Data.DomainObjects.ObjectBinding.Design namespace contains classes for design time support for 2-way data binding of user controls to domain objects.
Types or interfaces in this namespace are not intended to be used directly from an application.
The Remotion.Data.DomainObjects.ObjectBinding.PropertyTypes namespace contains classes that provide meta information about properties needed for 2-way data binding of user controls to domain objects.
Types or interfaces in this namespace are not intended to be used directly from an application.
The Remotion.Data.DomainObjects.ObjectBinding.Web namespace contains web controls to be used for binding user controls to domain objects in an ASP.NET environment.
The Remotion.Data.DomainObjects.ObjectBinding.Web.Design namespace contains classes for design time support for controls in the Remotion.Data.DomainObjects.ObjectBinding.Web namespace.
Types or interfaces in this namespace are not intended to be used directly from an application.
The Remotion.Data.DomainObjects.ConfigurationLoader namespace contains classes to be used for loading the configuration of the DomainObjects framework.
Types or interfaces in this namespace are not intended to be used directly from an application.
The Remotion.Data.DomainObjects.DataManagement namespace contains interfaces and classes for managing relations between DomainObjects in the DomainObjects framework.
Types or interfaces in this namespace are not intended to be used directly from an application.
The Remotion.Data.DomainObjects.Mapping namespace contains interfaces and classes to describe the domain model of the DomainObjects framework.
Types or interfaces in this namespace are not intended to be used directly from an application.
The Remotion.Data.DomainObjects.Persistence namespace contains interfaces and classes to persist domain objects.
Types or interfaces in this namespace are not intended to be used directly from an application.
The Remotion.Data.DomainObjects.Persistence.Configuration namespace contains classes to describe the storage providers used for persisting DomainObjects.
Types or interfaces in this namespace are not intended to be used directly from an application.
The Remotion.Data.DomainObjects.Persistence.Rdbms namespace contains classes to persist domain objects to relational databases.
Types or interfaces in this namespace are not intended to be used directly from an application.
The Remotion.Data.DomainObjects.Queries namespace contains classes to execute queries against the StorageProviders.
The Remotion.Data.DomainObjects.Queries.Configuration namespace contains classes to describe the pre-defined queries from the configuration file.
The Remotion.Data.DomainObjects namespace and its sub namespaces contain interfaces and classes to be used for building domain models that are persisted by the DomainObjects framework.
In the following, an overview is provided on the starting points for working with the Remotion.Data.DomainObjects namespace.

tr.td: Base class for all objects that are persisted by the framework.
Provides methods to execute queries within a ClientTransaction.

summary.para: The following list shows namespaces that provide implementations of Remotion technologies for the DomainObjects framework.

tr.td: An implementation of interfaces for the DomainObjects framework.
An implementation of classes for the DomainObjects framework.

summary.para: The Remotion.Data.DomainObjects.DomainImplementation namespace and its sub namespaces contain advanced functionality and services that assist in building domains based on re-store.

tr.td: Provides methods to create, get, and delete domain objects.
Provides methods to unload the data stored for domain objects from memory.
